paragraphs.text: Welcome to the State of Acute Malnutrition!
For wasting specific information, guidance and tools for COVID-19 response, visit ourCOVID-19 Adaptationspage.
Explore our Community of Practice on“Simplified Approaches to Treatment Across the Continuum of Acute Malnutrition”for resources, case studies, FAQ, and more.
Explore new UNICEF NutriDash data now available on the interactive map and graphshere.
Compareindicators across years, countries & regionson interactive maps as well as on new interactive graphs.
Access acute malnutrition data on over 20 indicators, from five sources, including prevalence, incidence and coverage.
Explore ongoing and completed research related to acute malnutrition in this interactive diagram.
Discover some of the innovative ideas emerging in the field to the barriers faced by programmes for the prevention and treatment of acute malnutrition.

Between 2015 and 2020, The State of Acute Malnutrition was supported by theNo Wasted LivesCoalition, an interagency effort between Action Against Hunger, the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation, the European Commission Directorate-General for Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection (ECHO), the innocent foundation, the International Rescue Committee (IRC), UNICEF, and World Food Programme (WFP). The CMAM 2.0: Reinventing Community Management of Acute Malnutrition grant supported by the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation that financed the No Wasted Lives initiative, is now closed.
